name: Overview
content:
Sales-Forecasting


Objective:

The Sales-Forecasting project aims to build machine learning models that accurately predict future sales for retail stores based on historical sales data, promotional events, holidays, and external factors. The objective is to enable data-driven demand planning, reduce stockouts or overstocking, and optimize inventory and supply chain operations across the retail network.

Approach:

Leverage supervised learning techniques such as Random Forest, Lasso, and Ridge Regression to forecast item-level or store-level sales over specified future timeframes.

Perform comprehensive data preprocessing and exploratory data analysis (EDA) on the sales dataset, which includes key features such as:

  • Date of transaction
  • Store ID and location
  • Product SKU and category
  • Sales quantity and revenue
  • Promotional and holiday flags
  • Economic indicators (if available)

Split the project into two workflows:

  • Training Workflow: Preprocess historical sales data and train multiple models (Random Forest, Lasso, Ridge).
  • Prediction Workflow: Use the best-performing model to predict future sales using new data inputs.

Significance:

  • Improve business forecasting accuracy to support effective inventory and logistics planning.
  • Enable dynamic and localized sales predictions tailored to individual stores and products.
  • Provide feature importance insights to highlight which variables most influence sales trends.
  • Support strategic decision-making in marketing, pricing, and stocking strategies.

Expected Outcomes:

  • Development of a reliable machine learning model to forecast short-term and long-term sales trends.
  • Visual dashboards to present predicted vs actual sales for performance evaluation.
  • Integration-ready forecasting solution for business operations teams to plan campaigns and manage stock levels efficiently.
